"Human aging is when our body gets old. This happens because we are born, grow up, and live. Our body changes a lot during this time. When we are babies, our body is small and weak. As we grow up, our body gets bigger and stronger. But as we get older, our body starts to get smaller and weaker. This is because our cells are getting old. Cells are like tiny building blocks that make up our body. When cells get old, they don't work as well as they used to. This makes our body get old too. So, human aging is when our body gets old because our cells get old."

The body of a human being gets old, or "ages," when the cells in the body get worn out. This process is a natural part of life. Our cells are made up of DNA, which is like a set of instructions that tell the cells what to do. Over time, the DNA in the cells gets damaged, and the cells stop working properly. This makes the body feel tired and weak. It's like a machine that's been used too much and needs to be fixed. The body also starts to lose its ability to fight off diseases, like the flu. It's like the body's defense system is getting weaker. Eventually, the body stops working altogether, and we die. This is a natural part of life, and it's something that happens to everyone.
